DataElement.preferredName: Transplant Patient Hepatitis B Surface Antigens Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator to ask if a blood test to look for presence of the surface protein for hepatitis B in a transplant patient had a positive result.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Transplant Patient Hepatitis B Surface Antigens
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of hepatitis B surface antigens in a transplant patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Those hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles. Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were formerly called the Australia antigen.

Concepts.definition: Those hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles. Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were formerly called the Australia antigen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have positive ti
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have positive titer to hepatitis B surface antigen (HBSAg)

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active Hepatitis B infection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a negative hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg] test and a positive anti-HBc [antibody to hepatitis B core antigen] antibody test)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a positive Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAG) test at screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there presence of hepatitis B core antibody [anti-HBc] and absence of HBsAg)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there presence of hepatitis B core antibody [anti-HBc] and absence of HBsAg?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a negative hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) test and a positive anti-HBc (antibody to hepatitis B core antigen) antibody test?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Chronic Disease Ind-3 (2018845v1) with VD Yes No Unknown Indicator (3506034v1) - dbw
